intro: Aretia crenata, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa and the Caribbean. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, zigzag-shaped stems. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Aretia crenata thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires partial to full sunlight. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
